diagnosis.vascularInvolvement: Abuts SMV (<180 degrees), no SMA involvement.
diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: Painless jaundice, dark urine, mild back pain, weight loss.

treatmentPlan.modality: External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT) with concurrent Chemotherapy (following induction chemo)
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV encompassing pancreatic head tumor + margin, potentially including draining nodal regions.
treatmentPlan.detailedConcurrentChemo: Capecitabine PO BID during radiation (Managed by Dr. Johnson)
medications: Pancreatic Enzymes (e.g., Creon) if needed for insufficiency

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine in BodyFix or VacLok bag, abdominal compression may be used. 4D-CT simulation to manage respiratory motion. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.immobilization: BodyFix or VacLok bag, abdominal compression.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: 3-point tattoos at isocenter projections (AP and bilateral laterals).
ctSimulation.contrastUsed: IV Contrast and oral contrast (for bowel delineation) likely used.
ctSimulation.ctNotes: 4D-CT acquired with immobilization/compression. Motion assessed. Data acquired for IMRT planning. Fused with diagnostic CT.

dosimetry.constraints: Kidney Mean < 18 Gy; Stomach Max < 54 Gy; Bowel Max < 54 Gy
dosimetry.planNotes: Neoadjuvant IMRT for borderline resectable pancreatic cancer.

fractions.setupNotes: Daily CBCT for soft tissue alignment. Good visualization of target.
fractions.sideEffects: Mild fatigue. Occasional nausea managed w/ Ondansetron. No significant diarrhea yet.

imagingAndReports.summary: 3cm hypodense mass head of pancreas, abutting SMV. Dilated biliary ducts.
Interval decrease in tumor size to 2.5cm. Continued abutment of SMV. Stable disease/slight response.
4D-CT acquired with immobilization/compression for IMRT planning.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Mark Johnson (Med Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt w/ new dx borderline resectable panc ca. ECOG 1. Stent placed. Recommend neoadjuvant FOLFIRINOX x 4 cycles then reassess for chemoradiation vs surgery. Discussed risks/benefits. Pt agrees.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Mark Johnson (Med Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt completed 4 cycles FOLFIRINOX. Tolerated fairly well w/ dose reductions. Restaging CT shows stable/slight response, still borderline resectable. Tumor board discussion: Recommend neoadjuvant chemoradiation (Capecitabine + RT 50.4Gy). Refer back to Rad Onc. Plan for surgical eval post-CRT.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Robert Evans (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt s/p FOLFIRINOX for borderline panc ca. Plan for neoadjuvant CRT: IMRT 50.4Gy/28fx w/ concurrent Capecitabine. Discussed rationale, procedure, side effects (nausea, fatigue, diarrhea, potential for more severe GI tox). Pt agrees. 4D Sim scheduled.

progressNotes.author: Physics/Dosimetry
progressNotes.summary: IMRT plan completed using 4D-CT ITV approach. Dose constraints met for kidneys, spinal cord, stomach, small bowel. Plan approved by Dr. Evans.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Robert Evans (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt completed 10/28 fx concurrent ChemoRT. Mild fatigue. Occasional nausea managed w/ Ondansetron. No significant diarrhea yet. Tolerating well. Continue plan.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Neoadjuvant (pre-operative) therapy to shrink the tumor and increase the likelihood of a successful surgical resection.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Fatigue, nausea, diarrhea (from both chemo and RT), potential for dehydration. Skin care in the treatment area. Hand-foot syndrome (from Capecitabine).
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Reporting fever, uncontrolled nausea/diarrhea, severe skin reaction, or significant pain. Importance of hydration and nutrition, potentially with supplements.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT, take oral Capecitabine as prescribed, weekly labs and OTVs, report symptoms promptly.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Take Capecitabine with food as directed. Use anti-nausea/anti-diarrheal medications as needed.
